{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3400065,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T11:16:45.293Z","cooked":"

Do you know what is the cof of the black tread sold by SDS and The Thrifty Bot? Or do you know how can I calculate it?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T11:18:27.826Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":621,"reads":580,"readers_count":579,"score":3231.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/1","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3400066,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T11:27:33.320Z","cooked":"

NB: Coefficient of friction is measured between two materials.

You could measure it by mounting it under a known mass, atop a horizontal surface that you want to measure as the pair of materials, and using a horizontal spring scale to drag the material. The highest force before it starts to move will allow you to calculate the static coefficient of friction and the steady state force while moving (and not accelerating) will give you the dynamic CoF.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T11:27:33.320Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":577,"readers_count":576,"score":140.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/2","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400097,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T13:35:10.669Z","cooked":"

This is how we do it. Ideally you have (access to) a piece of the competition carpet.
Then you just need something like these:

https://www.amazon.com/Sci-Supply-Newton-Force-Meter-Spring/dp/B0C6RBM2KQ

https://www.amazon.com/HFS-Chrome-Scale-Calibration-Weight/dp/B07HF3LXWQ

and some thread to tie it all together. (Odds are your HS Physics teacher has all this stuff and is very familiar with this experiment)

Can you share some of your results? We currently don’t have the equipment to measure that.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T16:02:12.531Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":427,"readers_count":426,"score":110.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/4","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400178,"name":"","username":"AnUnfunnyName","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T16:39:13.413Z","cooked":"

Spectrum did some testing on the CoF of various swerve treads in their open alliance thread. Their result for black nitrile tread was 1.542.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T16:41:31.391Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":408,"readers_count":407,"score":136.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/spectrum-3847-build-blog-2024/447471/19","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Spectrum 3847 | Build Blog 2024","clicks":147}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64792,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400198,"name":"Zachary","username":"Zatack7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T17:40:03.470Z","cooked":"

It is also worth noting that people have been arguing about the CoF of specific wheels on FRC carpet for the last 20 years (if not longer). You’re not going to find an objectively correct answer, and you’ll have to accept that there’s a certain amount of hand-waviness to the exact value.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T17:40:03.470Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":376,"readers_count":375,"score":105.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Zachary","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53819,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"ban the rev 40a breaker"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/6","custom_user_title":"ban the rev 40a breaker","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400203,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T17:48:36.622Z","cooked":"

One of the issues is that its NOT a simple COF problem. The rough/spiky wheels interact with the carpet, leading to things that look more like bending/shear. And measured “COF” above 1

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T17:48:36.622Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":186.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400205,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T17:50:56.589Z","cooked":"

More strongly: there is no single exact value - the model is an approximation, and the actual behavior can vary substantially depending on the exact situation.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T17:50:56.589Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":181.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53819,"username":"Zatack7","name":"Zachary","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zatack7/{size}/175437_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/8","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400260,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T21:18:14.165Z","cooked":"

In theory, practice and theory are equivalent. In practice, theory and practice are different.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T21:18:14.165Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":274,"readers_count":273,"score":199.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"John Hascall (he)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46267,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Opinions expressed are mine only"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/9","custom_user_title":"Opinions expressed are mine only","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":11,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400268,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-19T21:46:24.613Z","cooked":"

I seem to remember, quite a few years back, that a team was going to do a friction study with various treads and tread parameters (notably width), and intended to release the results.

When asked some time later where said study was, the team’s response was something to the effect of “nothing here seems to make sense, and we don’t see the point of spreading confusion”.

At least, to the best of my memory…

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-19T21:46:24.613Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":264,"readers_count":263,"score":107.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/10","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400436,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-20T16:08:05.754Z","cooked":"

Honestly, I think this adage inappropriately normalizes having a poor metatheory

Theories do not generally assert themselves to be error-free. Theories that do this are pretty suspicious, unless they’re very constrained.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2024-06-20T16:08:58.105Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":207,"readers_count":206,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467778,"topic_slug":"coefficient-of-friction","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":46267,"username":"john3928","name":"John Hascall (he)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/coefficient-of-friction/467778/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3400440,"name":"John Hascall (he)","username":"john3928","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john3928/{size}/143275_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-20T16:37:10.097Z","cooked":"

That’s how I take the adage: It’s tempting to think of the theory as giving the real world results, but things rarely work out that way, usually due to assumptions and simplifications (“assume a frictionless, uniform spherical cow”).

So we can compute the trajectory our shooter will give a ball, but I’ll believe it when we measure it on the prototype.
